page.title: 11EDUCATION IN ULLAPOOL.
page.content: Education in Ullapool started as Church Schools.Then followed a period in the Masonic and Village Halls, purpose built as schools, before moving to the present building in 1929.Primary and Secondary Departments occupied the same building. In 1954 the School was given the status of a Junior Secondary School. August 1974 the School was down-graded to a 2 year Secondary and 3rd.year pupils transferred to Dingwall Academy where they stayed in School Hostels. Ullapool Junior Secondary was up-graded to a 4 year Secondary School in August 1979 and then to a 6 year Secondary School in August 1985. From May 1985 the School name was officially changed to Ullapool High School.
